bullets.text: Ukraine and U.S. to discuss Trump-backed cease-fire framework in Switzerland, signaling potential shift in war diplomacy with Russia.
Zelensky faces domestic pushback and Trump pressure, constraining Kyiv’s negotiating latitude and war aims.
G20 showcased multipolar coordination on development and debt with limited U.S. engagement, underscoring shifting global leadership dynamics.
Israel punished commanders for October 7 failures, aiming to restore deterrence and public trust amid ongoing Gaza operations.
Asia-Pacific equities rebounded as revived Fed rate-cut hopes boosted risk appetite, lifting tech shares.
U.S. futures rose into Thanksgiving week as retailers lean on heavy discounting; holiday spending will set tone for Q4 earnings.
Bitcoin and long Treasurys rallied together, reflecting sensitivity to liquidity and rate-cut expectations rather than diversification benefits.
AI trade breadth is narrowing; even Nvidia strength can’t offset weakness across suppliers and beneficiaries, raising rotation risk.
Macquarie’s $7.5B bid for Qube sent shares up ~20%, signaling resurgent infrastructure M&A appetite.
Court filings allege Meta suppressed internal research on platform harms, elevating legal and regulatory risks.
X’s new origin labels flagged many “US” accounts as foreign-run, highlighting persistent influence-operations risk ahead of elections.
Insurers say generative AI risks are currently uninsurable at scale, constraining enterprise adoption and liability transfer.
U.S. cybercrime losses hit $16.6B; China leads quantum funding, underscoring escalating digital risk and strategic tech competition.
Geochemical evidence points to a Theia-like planetary body that formed the Moon, refining models of early solar system dynamics.
Solar superstorm “Gannon” crushed Earth’s plasmasphere to record lows, spotlighting satellite, navigation, and grid vulnerabilities to extreme space weather.
